title: IQ.cash
author: IQ.cash
content: Reading stories is my old habit. One day while reading stories online, I saw an advertisement, that advertisement was of Bitcoin, based on that source, my journey to Bitcoin or crypto currency.I want to present the past history of bitcoin or crypto currency in front of people through social media and so that people can know more about bitcoin because I think I should have known about bitcoin earlier. nowadays, people are very pioneers, so there are many who learn a lot at a young age. I would like to know your opinion on how to increase the interest of Bitcoin among teenagers on social media.By using what topics a common man will like to read about Bitcoin and will be able to gain clear knowledge about Bitcoin and show interest in investing in Bitcoin ?

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: If you have enough social media reach to be relevant and enough knowledge to give accurate information, then go ahead. This is not necessarily a new idea, there are lots of social media account dedicated to talking about cryptocurrency, a lot of them are just shills looking to build their followership by telling people what they want to hear, before using their reach for marketing.The forum search option would help you find very useful information about bitcoin's past which makes for good content.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: It won't be easy to introduce Bitcoin to make teenagers become interested in Bitcoin since they are too young yet and we know most teenagers are more exposed to gaming.Maybe you can try to introduce some blockchain games to them they might become interested in playing NFT games or games that give free Bitcoins.Or I think you can tell them about the potential of Bitcoin and internet money or digital currency that will become used widely locally.About the history of Bitcoin including the price of Bitcoin every block halving you can try to present this link below.- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_bitcoinOr check this one link below to learn about blockchain and development.- https://github.com/openblockchains/awesome-blockchains

comments.author: electronicash
comments.body: a common man would be more interested in how they can buy Bitcoin with cash?, this i think because they don't have bank accounts. a regular person would likely want to have some BTC after learning people got rich because of it.another topic that a common man may be interested is "How can I turn BTC into cash." a very common question from the very common man. these common men somehow are not interested in knowing history, they only want to know how to invest.

comments.author: ArikeTobi

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Teenagers like 15 or so? they're too young IMO. At this age, I'd rather them focus on enjoying their teenage years.Earliest to target would be young adults because compared to teenagers, they have more control over their lives for instance, some may have started their first full time job, much less monitoring/controlling from parents, being 18+, etc. It's also the age where people typically get interested on how to handle their money aka developing financial skills. But if you wanna appeal to common folks especially to young adults who has just started adulting, best to correlate bitcoin to something they're more familiar with. For instance, perhaps a financial literacy platform sprinkled with bitcoin on the side could do.

I would like to know your opinion on how to increase the interest of Bitcoin among teenagers on social media.By using what topics a common man will like to read about Bitcoin and will be able to gain clear knowledge about Bitcoin and show interest in investing in Bitcoin ?If you want to target the younger audience, you need to cater for their short attention span. One good idea might be short clips with bit sizes of Bitcoin's history in a fun way, maybe animated. That way when you start viewing from the beginning of the profile, you can watch the story chronologically. Social media users, especially teenagers, can't handle more than 30 seconds of content...and even that 30 seconds needs to capture their attention in the first 5 seconds, or else they will scroll onto the next piece of content.

comments.author: PrivacyG
comments.body: First step would be taking the false rumors about Bitcoin and its users out of their head.  Teenagers are from what I have seen personally more interested than any other generation was and this is good.  The bad thing is too many people think Bitcoin is a tool to launder money, hide from Governments et cetera and also think Bitcoin is all about money.I truly believe Bitcoin will gain a lot more traction as soon as Fiat gets more restrictions.  You feel surrounded by restrictions and this is where you may realize and find out Bitcoin is still a way to avoid all of that and be a little bit more free.These rumors have been out there since forever though.  Before, Bitcoin was known as the Silk Road Currency.  The mysterious and much illegally used Currency of the creepy Dark Web!  Now it does not have that reputation any more but it is in my opinion still a good idea to take the first step by making it clear that the purpose of Bitcoin is NOT to provide a way to launder money or hide illegalities.

comments.author: pinggoki
comments.body: Create your own content, you know TikTok and YouTube shorts right? You can probably use them as your starters for sharing informative videos about something and everything which is in this case bitcoin history, there's not a lot of things that you can talk about the past of bitcoin because it's still relatively young so you better be smart about how you will spread the information or maybe even create a long format informative videos if you plan to use YouTube as your starter then you can probably use the YT shorts feature as a way to tease them into learning more. I'm not knowledgeable about growing your following though, most of it's organic and once you're chosen by the algorithm expect that you'll get a lot of views from different strata.

comments.author: DapanasFruit
comments.body: Go where the young people can be congregating online - and yes even offline - and in there share content that can get their interest piqued on Bitcoin and how it is the future of money today. Naturally, share the many good features of Bitcoin and the many benefits that can be derived out of it starting on the financial side. We are all greedy and selfish...we are always asking what can we derived personally out of something so that can be a good area to focus on. Now, you can start a Facebook group on this matter too and even use X and Tiktok for the said goal. There are a lot of ways that you can utilize these days but you need to understand that it is not actually your job to entice young people to Bitcoin...you are just doing it for fun.
